entry.title: SAP S/4HANA configuration for SAC pull of plan data
entry.content:
This post deals with the SAP S/4HANA app “Manage Financial Plan Data Jobs - for SAP Analytics Cloud Integration” (in the following referred to as “manage” app) where mandatory configuration settings for pulling plan data from SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) into SAP S/4HANA tables like ACDOCP or FINSSKF are defined. These configuration settings are prerequisite for the app “Schedule Financial Plan Data Jobs for SAP Analytics Cloud Integration“ to execute a financial plan data job (for data replication). The integration using these two apps is available in SAP S/4HANA Public and Private Cloud Edition.

The goal is to provide guidance on the necessary configuration settings in this manage app and show example configurations based on SAC content for different use cases.

It is recommended to bookmark this post, as we plan to enhance it with further recommendations and configuration settings.

Before creating a configuration in this manage app, a tenant ID (with communication details) must be created first which is explained in the following online help:

  • SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/1cbcff7ccd35405ab445b223c1ab1588/1d0a86ae5db84da89a56481e9e73b5cf.html?locale=en-US
  • SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/48f4b4785b8e45938ac44a67be8032d9/1d0a86ae5db84da89a56481e9e73b5cf.html?locale=en-US

This post is based on the following SAC content for Integrated Financial Planning with possible plan data replications into S/4HANA tables but apply to other (customer specific) SAC models writing into these S/4HANA tables as well.

To simplify, we assume that depreciations are copied from the SAC model CAPEX to model OPEX and asset values ​​from the SAC model CAPEX to model Financial Statement Planning. So we only deal with configuration entries for plan data related to OPEX, Sales and Profitability Planning and Financial Statement. CO2 values ​​are also ignored (might be addressed in a later version of this post).

We start with functional and technical basics, continue with general recommendations and finally show some example configurations.

Functional Basics

For replication of plan data related to the three IFP models OPEX, Profitability and Financial Statement into SAP S/4HANA, the following SAC modeling details must be considered:

  • In contrast to Profitability and Financial Statement, only OPEX has a dimension for the debit/credit indicator to represent cost charges and discharges. However, for profitability and financial statement data, the debit/credit indicator ‘D’ is added by default when writing into table ACDOCP. The debit/credit indicator becomes part of the plan data scope explained below.
  • When transferring sales and administration costs from OPEX to Profitability, the same account used to post into Profitability is used to credit records in OPEX. However, in contrast to OPEX, product and plant information is added to these costs in Profitability.
  • The starting point for financial statement planning is a copy of actual data from the previous year’s financial statement. Then plan data from OPEX and Profitability are copied into Financial Statement, i.e. these copy processes do NOT result in corresponding credit records on the sender side.
  • The IFP content in SAC offers two possible sources for bringing a profit and loss statement into table ACDOCP:
    • Option 1: The model Financial Statement serves as the source to ensure a complete P&L statement. Since the copy of actual data is used as a starting point, the data can contain recurring extraordinary revenues and costs like the dissolution of accruals etc. 
    • Option 2: The two models OPEX and Profitability serve as the source. Here special attention is required for the account(s) used to transfer sales and administration costs from OPEX to Profitability (more on this later). In contrast to Option 1, this option has only operating costs and revenues.

Technical Basics

It is important to understand that contrary to table ACDOCA, table ACDOCP represents a multidimensional view. Therefore, the key fields of table ACDOCP consist of purely technical fields. This makes it necessary to specify a so-called aggregation level and plan data scope when writing data into table ACDOCP. These are explained below (among other technical terms for the Manage app).

  1. Aggregation level
    The aggregation level determines the fields of the records for which plan data is transferred into SAP S/4HANA. In the following mapping view of the configuration for the SAC plan data pull, the listed SAP S/4HANA fields are automatically translated into this aggregation level:
    As you can see in the last four columns of the screenshot above, it does not matter for the derivation of the aggregation level whether the field is mapped 1:1 from SAC, derived from an attribute (of an SAC dimension), or defined as a fixed value.
  2. Plan Data Scope
    The plan data scope influences which existing data records in table ACDOCP are replaced by the new plan data. Therefore, based on the fields marked “In Scope” (i.e. plan data scope) and their corresponding values from the plan data (to be written into ACDOCP), a data set is identified in the (multidimensional) table ACDOCP.
    It is important to understand that for the derivation of this “data set” not only the existing value combinations from the fields marked as “In Scope” are used, but also cross-combinations of these field values (see example 3 below).
    The following three scenarios show how new plan data with the respective plan data scope setting overwrites existing data in table ACDOCP.
    The more fields are added to the plan data scope, the fewer existing records can be overwritten with the new data, and thus the impacted data section is smaller (see example 2). This is also the reason why some fields such as the planning category or time-related fields like LedgerFiscalYear or FiscalYearPeriod are mandatory in the plan data scope, so that more data than desired is not accidentally overwritten when writing plan data into ACDOCP.
    In the configuration of the manage application, the plan data scope is defined in following highlighted column of the mapping view.
  3. Interaction between update mode and plan data scope
    Because the update mode for reading the relevant plan data records in SAC is a full update, SAC data is always written as a “whole” into table ACDOCP. Therefore, for cost-center-related costs, for example, FiscalYearPeriod and GLAccount should not be added to the plan data scope (to replace the existing cost-center-related accounts and periods with the new plan data). Another example are project-related costs, where the WBSElement, FiscalYearPeriod and GLAccount should not be added to the plan data scope. This ensures that the new plan data from SAC replaces the existing data in ACDOCP correctly.
  4. Account selection
    In the Filter Settings section of a configuration ID in the Manage app, meaningful data selections via G/L accounts are limited, as hierarchy nodes are not supported for the account field. For example, selecting primary accounts, cost accounts or balance sheet accounts using hierarchy nodes is not supported. Unfortunately, this type of selection is only possible via flat account selection, where the relevant accounts are then listed.
  5. Lock concept for writing into table ACDOCP
    Given that the lock concept for writing into table ACDOCP is based on the SAP S/4HANA fields PlanningCategory, ControllingArea, CompanyCode and LedgerFiscalYear, simultaneously running pull jobs into the same planning category can lock each other (for overlapping controlling areas, company code and fiscal year). However, in SAP S/4HANA no locks can occur if simultaneous pull jobs are writing into different planning categories. Therefore this should be considered when using multiple configuration IDs.

General configuration-specific recommendations

After clarifying some functional and technical basics, let’s look at the following recommendations for the configuration:

  • In general, overlapping plan data across different configurations which are written into the same planning category inevitably leads to inconsistent data when running the financial plan data jobs for the respective configuration IDs (due to the conflict with the plan data scope and subsequent mutual overwriting). An example of this is the configuration for (total) expenses and another configuration specifically for project-related expenses (subset of total expenses). Therefore, it is important to avoid such cases by defining different plan categories in the mapping section for the SAP S/4HANA field PlanningCategory.
  • Plan data from the IFP model Financial Statement must always kept in a separate planning category (in contrast to plan data from the IFP models OPEX and Sales & Profitability) to avoid inconsistencies due to duplicate figures. The reason is that OPEX und Sales & Profitability data is copied into the SAC model Financial Statement without crediting on the sender side.
  • In the case of writing OPEX and Profitability data into one planning category (for an alternative P&L report in SAP S/4HANA), having the field GLAccount as an additional “In Scope” field helps differentiate the two data sets (to avoid mutual overwrite), if OPEX and Sales & Profitability use different GL accounts. However, if, for example, a single GL account is used to transfer sales and administration costs from OPEX to Sales and Profitability, this approach no longer ensures disjoint data, and the plan data scope must be expanded. If, as shown in the following example, OPEX consists only of cost center data (and is marked as “In Scope”), and all Sales & Profitability data has a Plant, Sold Material and Customer allocation (and is marked as “In Scope”), disjoint data is ensured as well (without mutual overwrite):
  • A mapping of profit center and functional area values for a given configuration ID in the view ”Mapping of Financial Plan Data” ​​(to transfer both fields from SAC) is optional for OPEX and Profitability, since both would be automatically derived in the ACDOCP write interface if missing. If, however, Profit Center and Functional Area are mapped (and thus transferred from SAC), the correct profit center and functional area assignment is checked in SAP S/4HANA before writing plan data into table ACDOCP.  If this consistency check fails because, for example, the derived account assignment type returns a different profit center, an error message appears and the data transfer is aborted. Therefore, when mapping the functional area and/or profit center, ensure that the master data in SAP Analytics Cloud is up to date.
  • When using the SAP-delivered planning categories BUDGET01, BUDGET02 and BUDGET03 when writing into table ACDOCP,  the following default value for Budget Consistency Check (screenshot taken from SSCUI ID 102822) requires that additional (plan data scope) requirements be taken into account:For example, for project budget (planning category BUDGET01), plan data scope must NOT be active for WBSElement, FiscalPeriod, FiscalYearPeriod and CompanyCode. For the cost center budget (planning category BUDGET02), plan data scope must NOT be active for FiscalPeriod and FiscalYearPeriod.
  • Balance sheet data as part of financial statement planning requires a balance carry-forward logic to ensure that opening balance and balance sheet movements within a fiscal year are correctly replicated from SAC into table ACDOCP. Like in the SAC Export API, this requires mapping of the SAP S/4HANA global field BalanceFlowType (see in below file configuration ID 30001).
  • Costs split into fixed and variable costs in SAC can also be replicated and stored in table ACDOCP, which requires mapping of the SAP S/4HANA field FixedVariableType. In this case, the data records split into fixed and variable are merged into one data record on the SAP S/4HANA side, i.e. the total value (sum of fixed and variable) is written to the respective “total” measures (e.g. AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency) and the fixed value is written into the respective fixed measure (e.g. FixedAmountInCoCodeCrcy).

Example Configurations

Finally, the file in the following URL shows predefined configuration settings to give an idea of how to configure specific content in the mapping and filter section: https://d.dam.sap.com/a/MVuKTRq?rc=10&doi=SAP1225684

The first example (configuration ID 10001) from the file for OPEX-related plan data on cost centers and projects, including value-based allocations, is explained based on screenshots from the manage app:

Mapping of Financial Plan Data

  • For the SAC measure AMOUNT on the SAP S/4HANA side, the measure AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency is used (and the currency derived from a property of the company code), assuming the company code currency in SAC plan data.
  • The displayed plan data scope contains the mandatory plan data scope fields PlanningCategory, CompanyCode and FiscalYearPeriod (or LedgerFiscalYear) and is sufficient if there is no other overlapping configuration ID writing into the same planning category.
  • As described, ProfitCenter and FunctionalArea are not included, as this proposal relies on the derivation rules in SAP S/4HANA to derive the two fields in the background when writing plan data into table ACDOCP.
  • Including the source field FixedVariableType ensures that when writing into table ACDOCP the plan data is reformatted accordingly, i.e. the total value (sum of fixed and variable) is written to the respective “total” measures (e.g. AmountInCompanyCodeCurrency) and the fixed value is written to the respective fixed measure (e.g. FixedAmountInCoCodeCrcy).
  • In the example, the SAP Planning category PLN is used. Likewise, another category can be selected, which is maintained in SAP S/4HANA with Application Type “Periodic Planning & Consolidation” and Category Usage “NO specific usage” (in SSCUI 101970, Maintain Category for Planning).

Filter Settings for Financial Plan Data

  • The mandatory single value filter for the source field Version is maintained here. In the IFP content, the version Plan is used by default and may need to be adjusted if it differs in the custom data model.
  • It should also be filtered by planning period to select the plan data to the respective planning year.
  • In this example, further filter settings are not necessary because, on the one hand, this configuration is for OPEX-related plan data including cost centers and projects and only the AMOUNT measure is mapped. Other measures are excluded (like measures related to allocation weights ).

entry.title: Onboarding of SAP BTP Build Work Zone Service: Advanced edition
entry.content:
Do you know while planning to onboard the SAP BTP Build Work Zone Service, what is the checklist, onboarding steps needs to be follow?

SAP Build Work Zone is released with Standard and advanced edition.

We are planning to onboard the SAP Build Work Zone advanced edition.

Let’s discuss the high level.

Onboarding steps (disclaimer: It does depend on scenario to scenario)

S.No

Task

1

Create BTP Subaccount

2

Assign quotas & entitlements

3

Enable Build Work Zone service (Through Booster run)

4

Configure IAS & Trust

5

Setup XSUAA & Destinations

6

Create Roles and Role Collections

7

Add Business Content (Fiori, etc.)

8

Customize UI

 

Create BTP Subaccount:

Enable Cloud Foundry:

Trust configuration:

Add Domain and parameter : Review and complete.

Trust configuration completed

Validate the status of Trust configuration

Once you complete S.  No 1 & 2, then let’s run the Booster:

The SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition booster assists you by performing configuration steps automatically in your subaccount.

To run the booster:

  1. In the SAP BTP cockpit, use the breadcrumbs to access your global account.
  2. In the side menu, open the Boosters screen and click the Get Started with SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition tile.
  3. SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition contains integration with SAP Build Process Automation service. SAP Build Process Automation is a citizen developer solution to adapt, improve, and innovate business processes with no-code workflow management and robotic process automation capabilities. If you are not planning to use SAP Build Process Automation, you can remove the service when you run the booster.

Confirm to run the Booster

Follow all the steps and complete the Build Work Zone onboarding.

Delete all, apart from Advanced edition

Onboarding setup is running

Congratulations, Booster executed successfully.

Navigate to BTP Subaccount and verify the service.

Manual execution of the Booster: If needed.

If you encounter technical issues in running the booster, here are the steps that the booster performs for you:

In the SAP BTP cockpit, select a subaccount and perform the following configuration steps:

  1. In the Overview screen, enable Cloud Foundry and create an org and a space.
  2. In the Entitlements screen, assign entitlements to all the services that are listed in the Components table.
  3. In the Services  Instances and Subscriptions screen, subscribe and create service instances to the service plans that are listed in the Service plan configuration table.
  4. Create a destination to the content repository.

Run the Configurator

Launch the Configurator Wizard

After completing all previous steps, follow the configurator wizard to complete the onboarding process. You can access the configurator directly from the booster, or you can access it from the Site Manager as follows:

  • In the SAP BTP cockpit, Services  Instances and Subscriptions, click the SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition link in the Subscriptions table to access the application.
  • Open the Configurator screen from the left-side menu.

Go to Site Manager: Go to Settings

Enable Identity Authentification

Now run the configurator

Select the default or custom domain as per your scenario

 

Before triggering the setup, open the Destinations in SAP BTP Cockpit and download the trust

Now trigger the setup

Environment Setup completed, move to next step

Step 3: Configure the IAS, IPS to enable user authentication and user provisioning.

Switch to SAP Cloud Identity Service - Identity Authentication:

This step is only applicable to subscriptions created before March 20th, 2025. If you created a subscription after this date, your subaccount is already connected directly to Identity Authentication and you can skip this step.

Connect Your Subaccount to Identity Provisioning:

Prerequisites

  • The integration with the Identity Provisioning service supports only one active Identity Authentication tenant. Before you start the configuration, open the cockpit, Security  Trust Configuration, and verify that you have only one active Identity Authentication trust configuration in the list. The default IdP, sap.default, is not relevant to the flow and can be ignored for this requirement. After the connection is formed, you can configure additional active IdPs.
  • If you already have an active Identity Authentication tenant, you are required to reconnect it to the Identity Provisioning service after you've modified it.

Connector for User and Group Provisioning

Open the Settings screen from the left-side menu.

Go to the Identity Provisioning tab, and click the Connect button.

If your subaccount is not yet connected to the Identity Provisioning service, a new tenant will be created for your subaccount, and it will include the SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition connector. In addition, a connection will be created between the Identity Authentication service and the Identity Provisioning service.

If your subaccount already has an Identity Provisioning tenant connected to the Identity Authentication service, clicking the connect button will expand the scope of the tenant to include the SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition connector.

At this point, the connector is created with default values. In the next step of the onboarding, when you run the configurator, you will have to configure specific values.

SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition is also available as a bundle connector.

 

Click Assertion Attribute and add Groups form the list must start with an upper case

Add the Groups

Now add Default attributes : Add groups must start with upper case

Make sure you are selecting the correct value

Create Basic  WZ Groups with reference help portal

Do the same

Create an application in IAS: Go to application & resource application and open the SAML 2.0 configuration

Create Application

In next step upload the trust file and move to configure

Now enable the permission for Administrator

Add the secret client ID

Configure the Identity Provisioning service: Source and Target systems

Let’s do for Source system

Add mandatory properties

Remember to add the URL

Now setup Build Work Zone as Target

Add mandatory properties

Copy default transformation depending on API version

Run provisioning job

Check the job status

Congratulation job was able to read and create the users.

Now go to Site manager again and run the Configurator from below step.

 

Congratulations you have completed the onboarding process

Access the Build Work Zone

Note* This blog has not included all the steps screenshot, only major one added.

Thank you.

Please do share your thought.

 

Reference : https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-advanced-edition/sap-build-work-zone-advanced-edition/what-is-sap-build-work-zone-advanced-edition

entry.title: Departure of stage 10 must not be after Arrival
entry.content:
Hello Team,

This is reg. the error "Arrival date/time is earlier than Departure date/time" on the freight unit, which is not allowing to plan the freight unit.

this is happening when ATP confirms the order with backward scheduled with Route as 0 days transit. in this case, even though planned goods issue on same day but time will be > 00:00, but Arrival date is set to "00:00", which is causing the error "Departure of stage 10 must not be after arrival" while planning the freight unit.

Could you please suggest what should be standard solution for routes with 0 days transit with backward scheduling? (like custoemr pickup or same day deliveries)?

Best Regards,

Nagender.

entry.title: Re: Bulk UserID change in LMS
entry.content: At the system backend level, there’s a threshold that allows a maximum of 5,000 user merges within a 30-day period. To request an increase in this limit, a case with Support must be submitted for review (Considerations Before Bulk Merging Users Through Import).

entry.title: Issue In Error message in Unmanged Implememtation RAP
entry.content:
I have Handled error message in this way but when i try to track the call from front end i am receiving for only one call that is first :

          IF ls_data-message_type = 'S'.
            ls_table_log-guid = <lfs_entity>-brelguid.
            ls_table_log-instid_a = lv_matnr.
            ls_table_log-instid_b = lv_ep_note.
            ls_table_log-maktx =  <lfs_entity>-maktx.
            ls_table_log-typeid_a = 'BUS1001006'.
            ls_table_log-typeid_b = ls_note-objtype.
            ls_table_log-file_name = <lfs_entity>-file_name.
            ls_table_log-lifnr = <lfs_entity>-lifnr.
            ls_table_log-maktx = <lfs_entity>-maktx.
            ls_table_log-matnr = <lfs_entity>-matnr.
            SELECT SINGLE MAX( serial ) FROM zzimg_upload
                     INTO @DATA(lv_serial)
                      WHERE matnr = @LV_matnr AND
                            lifnr = @<lfs_entity>-lifnr.
            ls_table_log-serial = lv_serial + 1.
            ls_table_log-status = 'I'.
            APPEND ls_table_log TO lt_table_log.
            MODIFY zzimg_upload FROM ls_table_log.

             APPEND VALUE #( %cid = <lfs_entity>-%cid
              matnr = <lfs_entity>-matnr
              serial = <lfs_entity>-serial )
              TO failed-zzmm_material.

          APPEND VALUE #(
           %cid = <lfs_entity>-%cid
          %msg = new_message_with_text(
                                      severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-success text = 'Sucess' )
                          ) TO reported-zzmm_material.

            ls_data-message = 'Uploaded Successfully'.
            ls_data-message_type = 'S'.
            APPEND ls_data TO lt_data.
          ENDIF.
        ELSE.
*          lv_message = 'Please Check Uploaded Properties'.
          ls_data-message = 'Please Check Uploaded Image Properties'.
          ls_data-message_type = 'E'.
          APPEND ls_data TO lt_data.
          APPEND VALUE #(   %cid = <lfs_entity>-%cid
                      %msg = new_message_with_text(
                                      severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error text = 'Please Check Uploaded Image Properties' )
                          ) TO reported-zzmm_material.

        ENDIF.
      ELSE.
        ls_data-message = 'Already Uploaded'.
          ls_data-message_type = 'E'.
          APPEND ls_data TO lt_data.
           APPEND VALUE #(  %cid = <lfs_entity>-%cid
                       %msg = new_message_with_text(
                                      severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error text = 'Already Uploaded' )
                          ) TO reported-zzmm_material.

      ENDIF.

entry.title: In House repair: perfrorm diagnosis
entry.content:
Hello,

How do I perform the diagnosis on my repair order? I'm not able to do so.

Best regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: In House repair: perfrorm diagnosis
entry.content:
Hello,

Perform and confirm the Diagnosis (refer to Perform Diagnosis😞

Prerequisites:

  • The diagnosis has been triggered in the repair order and the repair order has the status Released.
  • The repair object has the status Diagnosis: Perform.

During the diagnosis phase, you create repair confirmations as follow-ups to the repair order. 
The repair confirmations are displayed in the transaction history for the repair object and the repair order. You can navigate to the repair confirmations from here.
Note: Do not select the Final Service Confirmation checkbox for repair confirmations that have been created for the diagnosis. If so, the status of the repair order automatically changed to Completed as soon as the remaining repair confirmation items are also set to Completed.

Finalize the Diagnosis:

Once you have finalized the diagnosis in the repair order, select the action 'Trigger Follow-Up Actions for Diagnosis'. The status of the repair object changes to Diagnosis: Follow-Up.
In the Perform Prechecks app, you decide on the next step for the repair object in the in-house repair process.

Perform Follow-Up Actions for Diagnosis (refer to  Perform Follow-Up Actions for Diagnosis😞

Prerequisites: 

  • You have selected the action Trigger Follow-Up Actions for Diagnosis in the repair order.
  • The repair order has the status Released.
  • The repair object has the status Diagnosis: Follow-Up.

Use the app 'Perform Prechecks' to decide the next process to be performed based on the diagnosis result. You can select one of the following options:

  1. Trigger repair planning and hand over the existing repair order to planning.
  2. Trigger the repair quotation process if the customer must first accept the estimated repair costs for the repair object.
  3. Set the repair order to Completed.

Kind regards.

entry.title: Re: What is the difference between the maintain and update permission in SAC
entry.content: I believe your looking at the role for Dimension updates? If yes, "Update" allows users to modify the dimension's structure, including adding, removing, or renaming properties or hierarchies. "Maintain" allows users to add members to a dimension, but not to change its fundamental structure.

entry.title: Re: How can we implement automatic QM inspection lot with...
entry.content:
Ramned

I see you are trying to use inspection lot of type 04, but have in mind that this is inspection type is based of GR. The trigger for the creation of inspection lot 04 is the Goods receipt. The option is to use the inspection type 13, creating the inspection lots manually for the planned order. This link seems to address your problem.

Solved: QM In Repetitive Manufacturing - Inprocess and f... - SAP Community

If they want to use the 04 inspection lot, the creation is upon GR. You can't create a inspection lot not assigned to a goods movement (GR/storage location transfer) and expect it to be stock relevant.

Best of luck!

entry.title: Re: (Custom) Idoc: issue when changing data type of a field
entry.content:
You have to remember what an IDoc is and how it is stored. Each segment is effectively a data container with the data of the segment stored in EDID4-SDATA with each field being located within a specific offset of the overall data container.  If you lengthen one field then you have stretched its contents to a space previously contained by some other data element.  Hence, if you want to lengthen a field what you are in effect doing is creating a new IDoc version, which is how you would manage that from a technical point of view without affecting older IDocs.

 

Regards,

Ryan Crosby

entry.title: Re: Developer Extensibility Public Cloud - QR code
entry.content:
Hello @lvbarat 

Adobe Forms in S/4HANA Public Cloud cannot convert a plain QR string into a QR image on its own. Even though you receive the QR string (like from the GST portal), you need to:

  • Convert that string into a QR code image (PNG or BMP).
  • Base64-encode the image.
  • Pass the Base64 string to the form XML so it can be displayed as an embedded image.

That’s how SAP expects QR codes to be handled in custom forms.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Data replication framework (DRF) setup in S4 public c...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

There’s no specific Best Practice scope item for DRF master data replication from SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Edition to decentralised EWM, but it’s fully supported.

Steps to follow,

  • Use Communication Arrangement SAP_COM_0247 for Product and Business Partner replication.
  • Trigger replication via Replicate by Replication Model App DRF_ADHOC_REPLICATION ()
  • Set up filtering and key mapping as needed (to handle old prefixes).
  • Monitor errors using Application Log or Application Logs-App ID F1487

Basic Integration with SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM)

Migrating On-Premises Connectivity from Neo Environment to Cloud Foundry Environment

Data Replication Framework

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) のプロビジョニングガイド
entry.content:
本ブログはSAP Business Data Cloud(SAP BDC)のプロビジョニング方法についてガイドします。
※本ブログの原文はこちらです。また、最新アップデート情報の確認のために、併せてSAP BDCのマニュアルもご確認ください。

このシリーズは、次の 5 つブログで構成されます。

Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング
Part 2: SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング
Part 3: SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング
Part 4: SAP Databricks のプロビジョニング、
Part 5: インテリジェント アプリとデータ パッケージのインストール

今回は、「Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング」です。

 

Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング

本ブログでは、SAP for Meを通じてSAP Business Data Cloudをプロビジョニングする方法について説明します。
管理者ロールを持つユーザーは次のタスクを実行することができます。
• SAP for Me 内で SAP Business Data Cloudをプロビジョニングし、「Business Data Cloud」システムを構成します。
• SAP Business Data Cloud Cockpit にログインします。
• SAP Business Data Cloud Cockpit へのユーザーアクセスを管理します。
• SAP Datasphere および SAP Analytics Cloud に Intelligent Applicationsをインストールします。
• SAP Datasphere にインストールするためにData Packageをアクティブ化します。
•「Business Data Cloud」構成に追加されたシステムの接続を監視します。

前提条件：
SユーザーIDが必要です。SユーザーIDを持つユーザーは、SAP for Me内でSAP Business Data Cloudのシステムを参照およびプロビジョニングできます。このSユーザーIDは、SAP BDCのオーダーの際に指定したBDC Entitlement Set(権限セット)が付与されている顧客アカウントにリンクされているIDである必要があります。

Business Data Cloudにアクセスするための手順 :

以下の手順は、BDC コックピットを最初にプロビジョニングする方法を説明します。

  1. SAP For Meにログオン
  2. ポートフォリオと製品に移動
  3. SAP for Me の SAP Business Data Cloudには、SAP Business Data Cloud アプリケーション、各アプリケーションにプロビジョニングされたソリューションの数、およびそれらに割り当てられた計画クォータが表示されます。
  4. このダッシュボードにアクセスし、ガイド付きのプロセスを通じてSAP Business Data Cloudのアプリケーションを簡単にプロビジョニングおよび統合することができます。
  5. SAP Business Data Cloudで有効なキャパシティユニット数と、SAP Business Data Cloud に含まれるソリューション間での割り当てが表示されます。SAP Business Data Cloud Core に割り当てられるキャパシティユニットの数は、ライセンス数に基づきます。
  6. SAP Business Data Cloudで「アプリケーションに移動」をクリックすると、SAP Business Data Cloud のプロビジョニングと統合ダッシュボードにアクセスでき、ガイド付きプロセスを通じて簡単にプロビジョニングと統合を行うことができます。
  7. ダッシュボードは中央ハブとして、SAP Business Data Cloud内のアプリケーションに対してインストールすることができます。
  8. アプリケーションタブを開くと、すべてのタイルが無効になっており、SAP Business Data Cloudコックピットを有効にする必要があることを示すメッセージが表示されます。「今すぐ有効にする」と強調表示されます。
  9. まず、名前を指定してリソースグループに割り当て、BDC Core製品を有効にします。リソースグループがまだ存在しない場合は作成してください。
  10. 「次へ」ボタンをクリックします。
  11. 「パラメータの設定」セクションで、リージョン、データセンター、所有者のメールアドレスを選択します。注: SAP Business Data Cloud Coreとそのソリューションが同じデータセンターにプロビジョニングされていることを確認してください。
  12. 「レビュー」をクリックします。
  13. 必要に応じてパラメータを修正し、準備ができたら「完了」をクリックします。
  14. 指定したリソースグループ内のテナントを表示するには、「リソースで表示」をクリックします。
  15. リソースタブでは、ソリューションのステータスは「処理中」で、プロビジョニングが完了すると「準備完了」に変わります。
  16. プロビジョニング時に指定されたSAP Business Data Cloudのシステム所有者は、テナントがプロビジョニングされると電子メール通知を受け取ります。
  17. プロビジョニングが完了すると、「顧客ランドスケープ」タブの下に新しくプロビジョニングされたテナントが表示され、そこに提供されているテナントリンクを通じてテナントに直接アクセスすることもできます。
  18. 「アプリケーションタブ」に戻ると、SAP Business Data Cloudに含まれる製品のタイルが有効になり、プロビジョニングを開始できます。
  19. テナントの準備ができたら、「リソース」タブの下のリンクとテナントの詳細からテナントにアクセスできるようになります。
  20. 「顧客ランドスケープ」では、新しいテナントのシステムの詳細を確認できます。また、システム統合が視覚的に表示されるため、システムランドスケープを理解しやすく、操作しやすくなります。
  21. 次のステップとして、「フォーメーション」を作成し、SAP Business Data Cloudコックピット/テナントと他のプロビジョニングされたテナントを統合する必要があります。
  22. 製品とポートフォリオ > Business Data Cloud > 顧客ランドスケープ > フォーメーション にアクセスし、「フォーメーションの作成」をクリックします。
  23. フォーメーション名とフォーメーションタイプを入力してください
  24. 次に、SAP BDCテナントを選択し、この特定のフォーメーションに追加して同期させます。
  25. 「次へ」をクリックしてフォーメーションの作成を続行してください。

これで、SAP BDC コアのプロビジョニングが正常に完了し、BDC コックピットにアクセスする準備が整いました。

SAP BDCテナントの解除

SAP Business Data Cloud、SAP Datasphere、およびSAP Analytics CloudテナントがSAP for Me でプロビジョニングされると、自分でプロビジョニング解除することはできません。
これらのテナントをプロビジョニング解除するには、次の手順に従います。

  1.  SAP Datasphere または SAP Analytics CloudテナントにSAP Business Data Cloud コンテンツがすでに存在する 場合は 、すべてのIntelligent Applicationsをアンインストールし、すべてのData Packageを非アクティブ化してから、テナントからすべての関連オブジェクトを削除します。
    カタログがSAP Databricks Unity カタログにマウントされている場合は 、マウントを解除します。
  2.  SAPサポートにケースを送信し、テナントのプロビジョニング解除をリクエストしてください。ケースにはサポートコード「BDC-CPT-PROV」を明記してください。

プロビジョニングサポート

プロビジョニングに関する問題がある場合は、 サポートチケットを開いてください。
問題に応じて、チケットに適切なサポート コードを指定してください。
SAP Business Data Cloud Provisioning - 一般およびコックピット : BDC-CPT-PROV
SAP Datasphere : DS-PROV
SAP Analytics Cloud : LOD-ANA-ADM-APS
SAP Databricks : 「SAP テクニカル サポートからのヘルプのリクエスト」を参照してください 。


※ このブログの原文を書いてくれたShreyasri Boseに感謝します。

entry.title: A question on SAP Marketing Cloud Coupons (and Offers)
entry.content:
Hello marketers experts!

We are starting to work with Offers and Coupons in SAP Marketing Cloud at my organization.

Since our coupons are generated by an external system, we mass upload them into Marketing Cloud through the "Manage Coupons" app. The coupon type and relationship type combination that best suits us is "Multiple Coupon Codes and Contact Assigned Dynamically"

Later, we create an Offer and we assign a target group to that Offer (because of the eligibility criteria).  That Static Target Group is the same that receives the campaign at the end. And we include the coupon cod on the email content we send in that campaign. We follow this process (Solved: Sending coupon via email in SAP Marketing Cloud - SAP Community)

After sending the email campaign with the offer code, I am requested to send the contact ID and the coupon cod that contact received through our email campaign, before the contact redeems it. Immediately after the campaign was sent or the coupon was assigned.

I tried visualizing that data through the Browse Interaction Data but it was not possible to see them from the standard view (I tried to add "coupon cod e" and wasn't there). I did see the coupon cod e assigned to a particular contact though, there at Browse Contact Interaction Data, I went inside each outbound email interaction and see the Offer and Coupon Section and there it was the coupon cod e assigned to the contact. Still, to do that for a lot of contacts is not efficient.

From the Analytics and Report Gallery Offer reports the coupons are not visible, I could just see offers. (We don't have SAC either)

I understand that SAP Marketing Cloud assigns the coupon codes randomly to the contacts present in the target group. And I want to mass extract that assignation of contact ID (or email ID, or interaction ID) and coupon cod assigned. Is that possible?

entry.title: Re: G/L OIM issue
entry.content:
Hello @SAM123567 ,

You cannot simply deactivate and reactivate OIM without cleansing the BSIS,BSAS and other such tables. SAP locks the account if inconsistencies are found in the line item and index tables.

1. If you really want to reset OIM from scratch, deactivate OIM using transaction FAGL_ACTIVATE_OP. Clean index tables manually or via program RFSEPA03 (consult SAP note first). Delete entries in BSIS/BSAS for that account before reactivation. Then re-activate OIM with the correct switch-on date.
2. Another option is to run transaction SE38, and execute program RFSEPA01 (check/repair open item management inconsistencies). It compares BSIS/BSAS with BSEG. If inconsistencies are found, you may be able to correct them with RFSEPA02 (use carefully in non-prod first!). This is "Consulting Solution" - use with extreme caution. 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Role for Manufacturer
entry.content:
Hello @KeLaw,

Try below two options and let me know.

1.Create Manufacturer BPs Without a Supplier Role.Create a new BP without assigning any purchasing-related roles like FLVN00 or FLVN01. These BPs will act as manufacturers only and will not appear in supplier-related F4 helps, ensuring a clear separation. Assign only the "000000 – General Role" or optionally, create a custom BP role (non-transactional).
2. Assign Manufacturer to Material Master. In the “Purchasing” view of the Material Master, Field: Manufacturer (MFRNR). Use the F4 help to select from existing BPs (you’ll see all BPs, so naming or grouping becomes important)

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,

entry.title: Re: Setup a new ledger in the year of brown field conversion
entry.content:
Hello @HTO ,

1. Add the tax ledger after the first fiscal year post-conversion. This is SAP’s recommended approach. Complete the S/4HANA brownfield conversion with only the HGB ledger. Start the tax ledger in the next fiscal year (e.g., FY 2026).
2. Other option is use extension Ledger temporarily, only for simulation. SAP allows extension ledgers, which do not store actual transactional data, but overlay adjustments on top of a base ledger. You can create an extension ledger for tax view. Post adjustment entries manually (or via BADI) that simulate tax effects. Use this for reporting only, not legal postings.  Please note - extension ledgers cannot be used for Asset Accounting or depreciation calculations—they’re for reporting only.

However, consult SAP for appropriate approach.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Tax id rule setting in SAP (Taiwan)
entry.content:
Hello @SM1970 ,

In Taiwan, companies are legally required to validate Tax ID (VAT Registration Number) structure. I guess your are referring to same only. If that's the case then, enable tax number categories. For BP or customer/vendor tax ID setup, Go to OY17: Define tax number categories. Example: TW – VAT Reg. No. Now, go to OY18: Assign tax number categories to country (TW).


Secondly, maintain validation rule using user exit or BADI (BADI_FITV_SUBSTITUTE)
SAP does not natively validate Taiwan VAT ID logic (e.g., checksum). You can implement a custom validation via: User Exit EXIT_SAPMF02K_001 (Vendor Master validation). BADI or implicit enhancement in standard function.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: inventory audit report, with added 2-column input dat...
entry.content:
Hello @totommyng ,

Here is a complete ABAP report template for SAP ECC to generate an Inventory Audit Report with the following fields:

-Material (Item)
-Description
-Quantity (Today)
-Quantity (Cumulative)
-Value (Today)
-Value (Cumulative)
-Cost/Unit Today
-Cost/Unit (Old Date)
-Cost Variance (Absolute and %)

-Uses MSEG, MKPF, MARA, MAKT tables.
-Uses two date parameters: current date and comparison date.

I got the sample script from my friend.

This is a classical ABAP report with ALV output.
If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

ABAP CODE is as follow:-

REPORT zinventory_audit_report.

TABLES: mara, makt, mseg, mkpf.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_output,
matnr TYPE matnr,
maktx TYPE maktx,
qty_today TYPE menge_d,
qty_cum TYPE menge_d,
val_today TYPE dmbtr,
val_cum TYPE dmbtr,
cpu_today TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
cpu_old TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
var_abs TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
var_pct TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
END OF ty_output.

DATA: it_output TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_output,
wa_output TYPE ty_output.

DATA: lt_mseg TYPE TABLE OF mseg,
lt_mkpf TYPE TABLE OF mkpf,
lt_mara TYPE TABLE OF mara,
lt_makt TYPE TABLE OF makt.

DATA: lv_qty_today TYPE menge_d,
lv_qty_cum TYPE menge_d,
lv_val_today TYPE dmbtr,
lv_val_cum TYPE dmbtr,
lv_cpu_today TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
lv_cpu_old TYPE p DECIMALS 2.

PARAMETERS: p_date_curr TYPE budat OBLIGATORY DEFAULT sy-datum,
p_date_old TYPE budat OBLIGATORY.

SELECT-OPTIONS: s_matnr FOR mara-matnr.

START-OF-SELECTION.

SELECT * FROM mseg INTO TABLE lt_mseg
WHERE matnr IN s_matnr
AND bwart IN ('101', '102', '561', '562').

IF lt_mseg IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE 'No material movements found.' TYPE 'I'.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

LOOP AT lt_mseg INTO DATA(ls_mseg).
SELECT SINGLE * FROM mkpf INTO DATA(ls_mkpf)
WHERE mblnr = ls_mseg-mblnr
AND mjahr = ls_mseg-mjahr.

IF sy-subrc <> 0.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

CLEAR: lv_qty_today, lv_qty_cum, lv_val_today, lv_val_cum, lv_cpu_today, lv_cpu_old.

" Cumulative values
SELECT SUM( menge ) INTO lv_qty_cum
FROM mseg
WHERE matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

SELECT SUM( dmbtr ) INTO lv_val_cum
FROM mseg
WHERE matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

" Today's values
SELECT SUM( menge ) INTO lv_qty_today
FROM mseg AS m
INNER JOIN mkpf AS k ON m~mblnr = k~mblnr AND m~mjahr = k~mjahr
WHERE m~matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND k~budat = p_date_curr
AND m~bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

SELECT SUM( dmbtr ) INTO lv_val_today
FROM mseg AS m
INNER JOIN mkpf AS k ON m~mblnr = k~mblnr AND m~mjahr = k~mjahr
WHERE m~matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND k~budat = p_date_curr
AND m~bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

" Compute CPU today
IF lv_qty_today <> 0.
lv_cpu_today = lv_val_today / lv_qty_today.
ENDIF.

" Old Date CPU
SELECT SUM( menge ) AS qty, SUM( dmbtr ) AS val INTO @DATA(ls_old)
FROM mseg AS m
INNER JOIN mkpf AS k ON m~mblnr = k~mblnr AND m~mjahr = k~mjahr
WHERE m~matnr = @ls_mseg-matnr
AND k~budat = @p_date_old
AND m~bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

IF ls_old-qty <> 0.
lv_cpu_old = ls_old-val / ls_old-qty.
ENDIF.

" Fill output
wa_output-matnr = ls_mseg-matnr.
SELECT SINGLE maktx INTO wa_output-maktx FROM makt
WHERE matnr = ls_mseg-matnr AND spras = 'E'.

wa_output-qty_today = lv_qty_today.
wa_output-qty_cum = lv_qty_cum.
wa_output-val_today = lv_val_today.
wa_output-val_cum = lv_val_cum.
wa_output-cpu_today = lv_cpu_today.
wa_output-cpu_old = lv_cpu_old.
wa_output-var_abs = lv_cpu_today - lv_cpu_old.

IF lv_cpu_old <> 0.
wa_output-var_pct = ( lv_cpu_today - lv_cpu_old ) / lv_cpu_old * 100.
ENDIF.

APPEND wa_output TO it_output.
CLEAR wa_output.
ENDLOOP.

IF it_output IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE 'No data found for selection.' TYPE 'I'.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

" Display with ALV
CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
i_structure_name = 'TY_OUTPUT'
TABLES
t_outtab = it_output.
